author: Susan Teodoro
title: Trivago - Manawatu/Whanganui best prices
text:
Last updated 18:32, July 16 2015 Nicklin Visuals 
A lunar rainbow on the road from Pohangina in the Manawatu. 
The best prices for hotels in New Zealand are right here in Manawatu/Whanganui, according to the world's biggest online accommodation search engine, Trivago . 
The 2015 New Zealand Hotel Price overview prepared by the online bookings giant ranks Manawatu/Whanganui as the cheapest place in New Zealand for accommodation at an average of $121 per night. 
Gisborne and Taranaki were the second- and third-cheapest at $124 and $145 a night respectively. WARWICK SMITH/FAIRFAX NZ 
A vintage car drives down ZigZag Road in Pohangina Valley, Manawatu. 
The most expensive was Otago at $234, with Marlborough next at $218 and Northland third at $179. 
Destination Manawatu chief executive Lance Bickford said pricing in the region was a strength. 
"It's an affordable package, especially for groups and conventions," he said. 
Bickford said FoodHQ, Massey and others would be using local accommodation. 
"You get more for your dollar here." 
He said some of the price differences reflected the type of accommodation on offer. 
"We have a lot of motels, which are cheaper," he said. 
The Trivago report said the region was 30 per cent cheaper than the national average, which is $172 per night. 

Whanganui is New Zealand's most affordable destination, averaging $112 per night, with Palmerston North the third-most affordable destination in the North Island and the fourth most affordable in New Zealand. 
Palmerston North and Whanganui have some of the most stable pricing in New Zealand, with average increases of only 10 per cent from the cheapest to the most expensive months. 
AA Tourism Publishing general manager Moira Penman said their monthly traveller survey showed about 60 per cent of Kiwis travelling to Manawatu and Whanganui visited friends and family. 
She said the region performed well compared to other parts of New Zealand. 
"In terms of travelling Kiwis staying overnight, Manawatu and Whanganui combined claim about 4 per cent of the total overnight visits made every year throughout New Zealand. 
"This is similar to the Coromandel Peninsula, Rotorua, Hawke's Bay and the Lake Taupo area and more than Nelson, Taranaki, Dunedin and even Queenstown. 
"They're hitting some good runs against other parts of New Zealand," she said of the region. 
Penman said in Manawatu, about 6 per cent of Kiwis stayed in hotels and 18 per cent in motels, with similar figures for Whanganui. 
"While the ratios of where people stay are similar in other regions around New Zealand, many of those areas are impacted by higher rates of overseas visitors," Penman said. 
She said inbound visitors increased demand for rooms, which could impact on prices seasonally, and the type of accommodation that was available. 

Trivago is the world's biggest online hotel search engine, comparing rates from over 700,000 hotels on more than 200 booking sites worldwide. The site is used by more than 75 million visitors a month. - Stuff
